case_vignette:
A 12-year-old female presents with hemorrhagic crusts on the lips and erosions of the oral, genital, and conjunctival mucosa for 2 days. According to the parents, there was a pneumonia outbreak at school. The patient also had a high fever and cough a week before the onset of cutaneous lesions. The parents deny any new medication and a history of allergies. The physical exam reveals no other skin findings. The patient is afebrile at the time of the presentation. The patient is a 12-year-old female.

The parents deny any new medication and a history of allergies. The physical exam reveals no other skin findings. The patient is afebrile at the time of the presentation. The patient is a 12-year-old boy.

I have sores with bleeding crusts on my lips and sores in my mouth, around my eyes, and in my genital area.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for 2 days.

I don't have any known allergies, but I had a high fever and cough a week ago.

No, none of my close contacts or family members have experienced similar symptoms recently.

No, I do not have any history of sexually transmitted infections or immune system disorders.
Final Diagnosis: Erythema Multiforme Major
